content.description: This is the middle route in the alcove in the right facing corner to the left of Babareena Pass. Climb a slightly bulging wall on too good to be true holds.  There is a crux mid way and right before the anchors.
content.location: 2nd route to the left of Babareena Pass

content.description: Slabby climb to the left of overhanging prow. 11b to the first anchor, 12a to the top.
content.location: To the right of Snake Flake

content.description:
Climb sharp, dirty rock past 2 bolts to a horizontal break. Continue on steeper, but much better rock to an intermediate anchor at an awkward stance. Keep going past another bolt on small holds to an anchor at the top of the headwall.

5.11 to the 1st anchor, 5.12- to the 2nd anchor.
content.location: The bolted face just left of the obvious right leaning prow feature at Babareena.

content.description: fairly sustained, tech climbing.  lots of trusting of the feet with little crimps and odd pockets, fun!
content.protection: 10 bolts + one drop in and one chain.  very weird to get lowered or rap off.  the last link of the chain is higher than the drop in, so your basically lowering off one bolt.
content.location: start on flake just left of babareena pass (a wandering crack) after flake turns into face climbing. new climb to the right?

content.description: This route climbs the right facing wall to the left of Babareena Pass.  There are 3 routes in this alcove and this is the right most one.  This is a fun pumpy outing if you don't mind drilled pockets.  The crux is right at the top before you clip the anchors.
content.location: First route left of Babareena Pass

content.description: Head up the slabby section to reach the base of the prow.  Follow suprisingly huge holds up onto the face to find some smaller pockets guarding the exit.  Fun and steeper than it looks.
content.location: Climb the prow at the right edge of the triple bulge feature.

content.description: Located on the blunt arete. Easy climbing through the first 4-5 bolts leads to thin pockets and what appear to be drilled monos. Climbing gets substantially harder and doesn’t let up until you clip the chains.
content.location: Look for the blunt arete. Farthest left on the right facing wall left of the crack.

content.description: Power through juggy pockets on three bulges.  Steep and pumpy, save some juice for the final bulge.  Pretty easy if you have the endurance.
content.location: Currently the left most route at The Babareena Area.  You'll find the frankensteps leading up the main trail to the base of this route.  Scamper up the flake leaning against the wall to clip the first bolt.

content.description: From the guidebook: "At the top of the hill. This wandering crack is fully bolted. 100 feet. sport anchor. A bit sharp."
content.protection: 11 bolts to the first anchor, then 3 bolts to another anchor (can lower from top anchor with 70m rope)
